page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO 04000204.
page.content: Our block consists of 3 small villages, several scattered farms and some housing alongside the roads. Otherwise the land is mostly devoted to farming. The 3 villages are called BAGENDON, PERROTT'S BROOK and BAUNTON. Much of the land is used for farming which is either arable or dairy. Some sheep graze on the higher ground. There are a few areas of woodland. The block is dominated by the River Churn which flows North to South through the area. The river flows in a steep valley which is followed by the A435 otherwise the ground is fairly hilly. There are 2 reservoirs which supply Cirencester's water needs and a quarry which is used to produce stone for house building.
